result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taylor R Peterson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Taylor R Peterson, in custody, in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 15CM179 and 15CM181. State - here for change of plea. Scholke there is a joint recommendation 15CM179 - all 3 counts will be DRI. 15CM181 - Count 1 repeater allegation dismissed, enter a NC plea. Count 2 repeater dismissed, enter NC plea. Count 3 would be DRI. Requesting court costs only on 1 & 2. State - has complied with victim notification, no request for restitution, agrees with representation of recommendation. Court 15CM179- court reads in and dismisses all counts. 15CM181- Court DRI count 3. Amends charge on counts 1 & 2 to delete repeater allegation. Peterson pleads NC to count 1 & 2 as amended. Court has plea questionairre and goes over it with defendant, finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea and waives his constitutional right to trial. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. State makes final statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Scholke makes final statement, asks to follow recommendation. Peterson makes statement, remorseful. Proceed to sentencing. Court does not follow joint recommendation and sentences to the following - 15CM181 - Count 1 - 30 days jail concurrent to any other sentence, costs. Count 2 - 30 days jail concurrent to count 1, costs. Costs due today, if not paid today enter civil judgment against defendant. Right to appeal, voting rights given, must submit DNA sample.
JT scheduled this case will be #1 and 15CM181 #2.

Defendant Taylor R Peterson appears via video FC jail with attorney Michael Scholke appearing in court. Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:05 PM. Called 15CF168, 15CF134, 15CM179 & 15CM181. Scholke has went over each complaint with Peterson, asks for PH (15CF168 & 15CF134), waives time limits and asks for bond to be continued, on 15CM179 & 15CM181 enters NG pleas to all counts on each case and asks for bond to be continued. Peterson indicates he is waiting for revocation. Scholke updates court on revocation situation. Court continues bond on all cases and misdemeanor cases to be set as STC, tracking with CF cases.  Status conference scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Taylor R Peterson in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:40 PM. Also called 15CM179, 15CM181 and FOSO Incident #15-16273 Peterson does not have complaints. Court reads all charges and penalties for all three filed cases. Peterson understands all charges and penalties, wishes to have an attorney, cannot afford his own (previously represented by Mary Burns). Burns states that the defendant does qualify for SPD but states she has a conflict. Court sets all matters for AIA. State informs Court of the defendant's open case in Oconto County (15CF109). Court continues bond on 15CM179 as previously set. State - bond - 15CM181 - $2000.00 cash bond. Court - bond - 15CM181 - $2000.00 cash, no contact with Jessica Bildeau and no consumption of alcohol. State - bond - 15CF168 - $2000.00 cash. Court - bond on 15CF168 - $2000.00 cash. Court - sets bond on new probable cause (15-16273)- $2000.00 cash, no contact with James Smith and no entry onto any property owned by Smith Concrete and no consumption of alcohol.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:45 am.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:45 am.
No consumption of alcohol (REFUSED TO SIGN)
